How does that show Kansans that this process served their interests to the very best of democracy’s ability?

I was elected to serve, listen to, and represent the people of the Third District. That’s where my focus is, and I hope others take heed.

Punishing people who speak up, minimizing the truth - that’s not how we move forward.

Fighting cancer like Heather, recovering from surgery like Debbie: no matter what, you should be focused on getting better, NOT dealing with a huge, unexpected bill.

I've fought to end surprise medical bills since Day 1. Now, those efforts are law.

https://t.co/rHwnQNx75R

Big Pharma spent nearly $30 million on lobbying last year - 16% more than in 2020.

We're not going to back down. As long as I'm still hearing from Kansans who are struggling to afford their prescriptions, I'm going to keep fighting for the people—not pharma.

Free, high-quality masks are now available in the Kansas City area, with more locations coming throughout the week. We are working to get everyone the tools they need to stay safe.

Don't forget to order your free at-home test kits from https://t.co/iwyj9v0D3o, too! https://t.co/TVjP9Z0IkE
We didn't stop. We kept working, we found middle ground, and we brought more people to the table. We won’t stop now.

People are tired of billionaires influencing our elections, tired of gerrymandering, and tired of the barrage of laws making it harder to vote—regardless of who they voted for.

I am disappointed the Senate didn't advance voting rights. But we have faced roadblocks before.

It's time to address the backlog of 700+ bridges in #KS03 that need repairs. 

While we're creating jobs to fix these bridges, we can also make them more resilient & pedestrian friendly.

The bipartisan infrastructure law is already making a difference.

https://t.co/slg90DJuRz

100 years ago, insulin began to be used as a treatment for Type I diabetes. It made front-page news in 1922 and went on the market for just a dollar - so why is it bankrupting people a century later?

It’s unacceptable. We must act to lower the prices of these life-saving drugs.

A great overview of the federal funds coming to Kansas from the new bipartisan infrastructure law I voted for, plus where we'll start to see that investment. 

First up? The US 69 / 167th St expansion in Johnson County is advancing thanks to the new law.

https://t.co/Wa439AlgBJ
Happy New Year! Let's make 2022 the year we finally close the Medicaid coverage gap in Kansas.

Wondering what the new infrastructure law will do for #KS03?

I joined @kcur this month to talk about just a few of the benefits: expanding Highway 69 in Johnson County, increasing our KCATA electric bus fleet, and creating good-paying, union jobs.

https://t.co/tceJIUmc26

#SB8 is extreme, and it’s dangerous. Every day that it stands, more people are at risk.
Wishing everyone celebrating a #HappyHanukkah! May this be a time of joy and togetherness.

Today, #SCOTUS is hearing challenges to #SB8, the extreme Texas law that places bounties on women seeking care and creates an unsafe environment for health care providers.

This law sets a dangerous precedent for states across the country. So much is on the line today.
We must act to modernize our election systems, restore faith in our democracy, and ensure every eligible voter can make their voice heard—no matter where they live.

We hammered out a bill to address the accelerating restriction of voting rights across the country, a bill that would end partisan gerrymandering and limit the influence of dark money. 

These priorities have broad support, only to be shot down again by Senate Republicans.

Check out the #ChildTaxCredit economic impact data from earlier this year. The extra money in Kansas families' pockets generated a $184,060,000 (!!) impact on our local economy.

https://t.co/5p6ADxWR0Y

The #ChildTaxCredit continues to reach more families each month with money to cover childcare, diapers, food, & more.

@USTreasury reports 321,000 Kansas families got their tax cut in October. That benefits our local economy, too, as families invest the money in their kids.

From KCK to Parsons, Kansans are stuck in the Medicaid gap, uninsured & vulnerable as state legislators refuse to act.

I’m pushing for a federal solution to close the gap and expand Medicaid. The state you live in shouldn’t determine your access to care.

https://t.co/7TjQugBh80

We have the first ever Native American serving as a cabinet member, @SecDebHaaland.

And we are seeing the benefits of Native representation at all levels of government.

Today, I encourage everyone to reflect on our history, good and bad, and to look proudly towards the future.

Indigenous people have been here for centuries, survived atrocities & persecution, and continue to carry on amazing, diverse traditions.

But today is a first. For the first time ever, we have a president who officially recognizes #IndigenousPeoplesDay.
People are getting back to work and the economy is getting back on track. We've got to keep up the momentum to make sure everyone is included in our recovery. https://t.co/IGlbC7pXsN

Proud to work across the aisle to reintroduce the Native American Voting Rights Act. 

https://t.co/qoTzJHRWgs

6,024 Kansans lost to COVID. My thoughts are with each and every family who has suffered the unthinkable loss of a loved one.

I join @LauraKellyKS in urging every Kansan to get vaccinated and follow public health guidance. We can end this pandemic.

https://t.co/7lAGmHdAvH
Read more: https://t.co/gWMdp8vYD4

As COVID continues to put immense strain on our systems, $50 million in emergency funding from the #AmericanRescuePlan is headed to KS hospitals and nurses.

That’s exactly what this federal relief is for—to get crucial resources to our frontline workers battling this pandemic.

The findings go on and on. Big Pharma is using the fact Medicare can't negotiate to raise prices on U.S. consumers. We need to change that.

Read it for yourself: https://t.co/4cHyK9zbfj

The new report on internal Pharma company documents is shocking, yes—but it shows what many patients have known for years: the system is unfair, and it's targeted.

If Medicare could negotiate prices on just seven drugs, taxpayers would have saved $25 BILLION over 5 years.
So powerful. Thinking of all the lives taken too soon, and the loved ones who keep their memories alive 20 years later. #NeverForget https://t.co/iItTxHD5kD

On #LaborDay, we are reminded of the workers who built this country. 

My mom was a union member for nearly 20 years. She worked hard to give my siblings and I opportunities to thrive. I carry that work ethic in everything I do.

Grateful for her and all hardworking folks today!
Congratulations to you both! https://t.co/XGwy6iFMtj

Women deserve the right to make their own health decisions. Period.

Getting kids back in school safely is a huge reason I voted for the #AmericanRescuePlan and other federal pandemic aid.

Now, Kansas schools are sharing how the money they received is making a difference: safer facilities, student counseling supports, and better-paid teachers.

In August, the #ChildTaxCredit put $147.2 million back in the pockets of Kansas families.

On average, families got a tax cut of $459 a month. The difference that would've made for my mom, raising me and my brothers alone? It's staggering. 

https://t.co/5p6ADxFfCo

It's #WomensEqualityDay! The passage of the 19th Amendment 101 years ago gave some (but not all) women the right to vote.

Your vote is your voice. When women vote, everyone wins.

Every eligible voter should be able to cast their ballot freely and securely—including people who live on tribal lands, which can be rural and geographically isolated. 

That’s why I introduced the bipartisan Native American Voting Rights Act. https://t.co/lbmJQsHCvB

Seems like a good day to finally allow Medicare to negotiate lower drug prices for patients—don’t you agree?

It's time to work together and act on infrastructure so we can get #KS03 moving again.

These three landmark cases are steps towards recognizing that everyone deserves equal justice under law.

Let's make it official and pass the Equality Act.

Via @41actionnews: https://t.co/OlG1v3dheO

June 26, 2003: Lawrence v Texas. SCOTUS ruled that same-sex sexual activity is legal in every state

June 26, 2013: DOMA falls. SCOTUS ruled that same-sex couples can access federal benefits

June 26, 2015: Obergefell v Hodges. SCOTUS ruled that marriage is a right & #LoveIsLove

June 26 is a special day for LGBTQIA+ Americans.

See the thread below for a little judicial history lesson on why today is significant, and why we must keep pushing for equality. #Pride2021
Can confirm 👏🏽 https://t.co/higGTCICXu

You deserve a Representative who will stand up for your values, not someone trying to resurrect Sam Brownback’s agenda. 

I’m running for Congress to move us forward. My name is Sharice Davids, and I would be proud to earn your vote.

You have a very clear choice in this election. 

Between someone who embraces Donald Trump and his brand of politics - and someone who knows that we can do better. 

Between someone who championed the Brownback tax experiment - and someone who fought against it. #KS03

Too many Kansas families struggle with the price of healthcare, and that’s why I’ve fought to bring down the costs, including prescription drugs and premiums, and to protect people with pre-existing conditions. #KS03 https://t.co/Sqv5PPiKLx

So many families are feeling the anxiety of not knowing how they will be able to pay their bills or put food on the table for their families. 

That's why I've voted for bipartisan relief for #KS03, and why I'm pushing for more aid for our families, workers, and small businesses.

Our country is going through a difficult and long overdue conversation about racial inequality. I've had conversations with community members and law enforcement about what it looks like to build up trust. I'm committed to listening to EVERYONE. That's what #KS03 deserves.

We need more opportunities for everyone in our community. That starts with quality public education. We have to invest in public schools, in early childhood education. We also need to make sure that everyone has access to affordable quality health care. #KS03

My opponent has a different view. She was a campaign manager and top advisor for former Governor Sam Brownback. 

She worked hard to pass Brownback’s tax plans and cuts to our schools. She even said that he was an “incredible governor.” I disagree. #KS03

I was raised by a single mom Army Veteran. I started out at Johnson County Community College.

Every opportunity I’ve had in my life has stemmed from the fact that I had a good public education. 

I want every kid in our community to have that same opportunity to succeed. #KS03
